com.tigertext.ttandroid.api

Class TT

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tigertext.ttandroid.api.TT
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TTPubSub.Listener

    public class TT
extends java.lang.Object
implements TTPubSub.Listener
    This class is used to instantiate all the Managers in the SDK and is the entry point to the Tigertext SDK. Call TT.init in the Application's onCreate() method. Once init, every manager can be referenced using getters.

    Created by srinivas.rasamsetti on 6/5/15. Modified by GK.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static TT getInstance()
                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Per SDK design patterns, getInstance should only work if SDK initialized.
        Returns:
        The current instance of the TT SDK, or a IllegalStateException if init(Context, String) hasn't been called yet.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • init

        public static TT init(@NonNull
                      android.content.Context context,
                      java.lang.String authorityString)
        Initializes all of the TT SDK Managers. This must be called before using any of the TT SDK features. Ideally, this should be called inside Application.onCreate()
        Parameters:
        context - The context of your activity or application. Will get the Application context to avoid activity leaks.
        Returns:
        initialized TT object. This instance can be retrieved later via getInstance()

        public void onLoginInit()

      • sync

        public void sync(TT.SyncListener listener)
        Fetch data from server at first login. Subsequent data changes will be driven by SSE/GCM

      • startService

        public void startService(boolean forceReconnect)
        Use this method if you want to start service, forcing it to reconnect to SSE
        Parameters:
        forceReconnect - True if an already started service should explicitly disconnect. Can be useful if a bad socket state occurs and the TT server send updates via FCM.

      • stopService

        public void stopService()
        This method stops the SSE service
        See Also:
        for the current status of the service.

        public void close()
        Do not call this directly. Will be closed during logout

      • setHasMetadata

        public void setHasMetadata(boolean hasMetadata)
        Set whether network requests should also include a RosterEntry's metadata. Because many of TT services use metadata, like all of RosterEntry.FEATURE_SERVICEs, it would be best to not change this default behavior of true.
        Parameters:
        hasMetadata - True to include metadata, false if metadata should not be returned.

      • hasMetadata

        public boolean hasMetadata()

      • getHttpManager

        public HttpManager getHttpManager()

      • setUserAgent

        public void setUserAgent(java.lang.String userAgent)
        Clients of TT should call this method right after TT.init to set the user-agent to be sent in the http requests. If this api is not called, sdk will use default user-agent
        Parameters:
        userAgent - The user agent to use for all requests
